body:
**Is this a BUG REPORT or FEATURE REQUEST?**:
/kind bug
/sig windows

**What happened**:

This is being logged on kubelet stderr on Windows frequently.

```
kubelet.err.log:4832:E0711 22:12:49.241358    2872 helpers.go:735] eviction manager: failed to construct signal: "allocatableMemory.available" error: system container "pods" not found
in metrics
kubelet.err.log:4836:E0711 22:13:07.280146    2872 helpers.go:735] eviction manager: failed to construct signal: "allocatableMemory.available" error: system container "pods" not found
in metrics
kubelet.err.log:4840:E0711 22:13:25.329707    2872 helpers.go:735] eviction manager: failed to construct signal: "allocatableMemory.available" error: system container "pods" not found
in metrics
kubelet.err.log:4847:E0711 22:13:43.366465    2872 helpers.go:735] eviction manager: failed to construct signal: "allocatableMemory.available" error: system container "pods" not found
in metrics
kubelet.err.log:4850:E0711 22:14:01.400386    2872 helpers.go:735] eviction manager: failed to construct signal: "allocatableMemory.available" error: system container "pods" not found
in metrics
kubelet.err.log:4854:E0711 22:14:18.452759    2872 helpers.go:735] eviction manager: failed to construct signal: "allocatableMemory.available" error: system container "pods" not found
in metrics
kubelet.err.log:4860:E0711 22:14:36.492418    2872 helpers.go:735] eviction manager: failed to construct signal: "allocatableMemory.available" error: system container "pods" not found
in metrics
kubelet.err.log:4865:E0711 22:14:54.518323    2872 helpers.go:735] eviction manager: failed to construct signal: "allocatableMemory.available" error: system container "pods" not found
in metrics
kubelet.err.log:4869:E0711 22:15:12.549471    2872 helpers.go:735] eviction manager: failed to construct signal: "allocatableMemory.available" error: system container "pods" not found
in metrics
kubelet.err.log:4872:E0711 22:15:30.576748    2872 helpers.go:735] eviction manager: failed to construct signal: "allocatableMemory.available" error: system container "pods" not found
in metrics
kubelet.err.log:4879:E0711 22:15:48.608999    2872 helpers.go:735] eviction manager: failed to construct signal: "allocatableMemory.available" error: system container "pods" not found
in metrics
kubelet.err.log:4883:E0711 22:16:06.643661    2872 helpers.go:735] eviction manager: failed to construct signal: "allocatableMemory.available" error: system container "pods" not found
in metrics
```

**What you expected to happen**:

I would expect this metric to be implemented, and no error logs

**How to reproduce it (as minimally and precisely as possible)**:

- Deploy a cluster, I used acs-engine 0.19.2 with Kubernetes 1.11 on Windows Server version 1803
- `kubectl apply -f https://raw.githubusercontent.com/PatrickLang/Windows-K8s-Samples/master/iis/iis-1803.yaml`


**Anything else we need to know?**:

**Environment**:
- Kubernetes version (use `kubectl version`): 1.11
- Cloud provider or hardware configuration: Azure
- OS (e.g. from /etc/os-release): Windows Server version 1803

/assign @feiskyer

labels.description: Categorizes issue or PR as related to a bug.
labels.name: kind/bug

labels.description: Categorizes an issue or PR as relevant to SIG Windows.
labels.name: sig/windows

title: Windows kubelet - failed to construct signal: "allocatableMemory.available" error
